meanings.definition: A number of people or things following one another in order.
meanings.sent1: In the parade, the marching band moved in succession, one group after another.
meanings.sent2: The succession of cars waiting at the traffic light seemed endless.
meanings.sent3: The succession of puppies following their mother was quite adorable.
meanings.sent4: The succession of waves crashing onto the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The succession of students entering the classroom created a bustling atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The action or process of inheriting a title, office, property, etc.
meanings.sent1: After his father's retirement, John's succession to the family business was expected.
meanings.sent2: The prince's succession to the throne was celebrated with great pomp and ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The cat's succession to the coveted spot on the couch caused a playful commotion.
meanings.sent4: Her succession to the role of team captain brought new energy to the group.
meanings.sent5: The puppy's succession to the chew toy sparked a playful chase around the room.

meanings.definition: The sequence in which one person or thing follows another in time.
meanings.sent1: The succession of events in the story kept the readers engaged.
meanings.sent2: The succession of seasons brings about changes in nature.
meanings.sent3: The succession of knocks on the door made her wonder who could be visiting.
meanings.sent4: The succession of melodies in the song created a harmonious blend.
meanings.sent5: The succession of colors in the sunset painted the sky with beauty.
